intro: Finlaysonia khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi finlaysonia, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
